message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about octopuses and their defense mechanisms. Octopuses excrete ink as a defense mechanism when they are in danger. The ink creates a dark cloud that confuses predators and allows the octopus to escape. Option (B) is incorrect because octopuses are not capable of flying. Option (C) is incorrect because cooking is not a natural circumstance where octopuses would excrete ink. Option (D) is also incorrect because, as explained earlier, octopuses do excrete ink when they are in danger.

Option (C) is incorrect because cooking does not trigger the release of ink in octopuses. Option (D) is incorrect because octopuses do excrete ink as a defensive response.
